sentence.Network_en: The president is not willing to abase himself before the nation.
sentence.Network_cn: 总统不愿在全国人民面前降低自己的威信.

sentence.Network_en: He refused to abase himself in the eyes of others.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不愿在他人面前被贬低.

sentence.Network_en: A man who uses bad language will only abase himself.
sentence.Network_cn: 说脏话者只会自贬身分.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  from Old French abaissier, from a- (from Latin ad 'to, at') + baissier 'to lower', based on late Latin bassus 'short of stature'. The spelling has been influenced by base

means.word_mean: 1. cause to feel shame; hurt the pride of;

sentences.sentence: "He humiliated his colleague by criticising him in front of the boss"

stems_affixes.word_buile: base低下,基础+born出生→adj.出生低微的
debase降低+ed……的→adj.贬低的;品质恶劣的
base低下,基础+ball球→建立基础打球→垒球
base低下,基础+ment具体物→n.地下室
base低下的+ness表名词→n.卑鄙, 下贱
sub下+base低下,基础→地基下的地基
